name: A. Wrong Subtraction
statement: Little girl Tanya is learning how to decrease a number by one, but she does it wrong with a number consisting of two or more digits. Tanya subtracts one from a number by the following algorithm:  if the last digit of the number is non-zero, she decreases the number by one;  if the last digit of the number is zero, she divides the number by 10 (i.e. removes the last digit). You are given an integer number . Tanya will subtract one from it  times. Your task is to print the result after all  subtractions.It is guaranteed that the result will be positive integer number.
input: The first line of the input contains two integer numbers  and  (, ) — the number from which Tanya will subtract and the number of subtractions correspondingly.
output: Print one integer number — the result of the decreasing  by one  times. It is guaranteed that the result will be positive integer number.
tutorial: In this problem you just need to simulate the process described in the statement (i.e.  times repeat the following operation: if  then  else ) and print the result.
